column1: Apply Now – Business Analyst – West Coast (Remote)
Business Analyst Job Responsibilities
If you read our business analyst job posting and thought
column3: but what is this job actually like?”

column1: The core function of our role as business analysts at Grant Street Group is to be a liaison between our developers and our clients
column2: and this requires us to wear many different hats.

column1: So what do all of these “hats” really mean?
Problem Solving: Every day you work to solve complex problems. When you analyze a calculation
column2: investigate the cause of a bug
column3: or propose a new process you are venturing into unfamiliar territory to find a solution. Our clients and developers rely on your problem solving skills to ensure our software is built and supported effectively.

column1: Client support: When a customer has a question
column4: they come to you! You are known as a subject matter expert and our clients rely on that expertise regularly. Whether the issue is major or minor
column5: you know that Grant Street Group takes Software as a Service literally.

column1: Prioritization: Our software is ever-changing. With that comes the need to prioritize what
column3: and how changes are made. Since you’re working with the software and our clients daily
column4: who better to prioritize than you? Business analysts are constantly asking themselves: Does this feature need to be completed before a certain time? What is the impact of this bug? How can other clients benefit from this change? We use a ticketing system to track pieces of work such as functionality requests and bug fixes. We then prioritize them for developers to work on.

column1: Technical Specifications: It’s your job to convey to the developers what changes need to be made. What happens when you click this button? What does the page look like? How is this file transferred to an external system? In this way
column2: you are directly affecting the product and our clients’ experience.

column1: Testing: When a developer completes a change
column2: you get to test it out (in a beta environment) to ensure that it’s working correctly. Does the new behavior match the specification? Does everything else surrounding the change still work correctly?

column1: Implementations: We’re a growing company and adding new clients is an exciting part of that growth! Since you’re a subject matter expert
column2: you coordinate with new clients to configure the software to best fit their needs. Think of yourself as a consultant. What business processes does the client need to accomplish? How can our software fit in with and help that process?

column1: Training: Helping clients learn about how our software works is also part of your role. Whether it’s a new client coming up to speed on how tasks are completed
column2: or an existing client that is incorporating a new feature into their process
column3: you’re a resource for providing the information and tools they need.

column1: Does this sound exciting and overwhelming at the same time? Most of us thought so too. If you haven’t had experience in this area before
column2: know that many of us lacked business analyst experience before we came to Grant Street Group. What we did have was intellectual curiosity and a passion for problem solving. If you’ve already had business analyst experience
column4: and we’re excited about the possibility of you continuing on that path with us.

column1: So now that you know what we do
column2: why are you a great fit? You’ve probably spent a large majority of your life asking “Why” and then making sure that you figure out the answer. You love using all parts of your brain equally
column3: and the thought of speaking with a client or learning about a database schema equally intrigues you. You’re the one that people rely on in team projects. You’re always itching to know more and you hold yourself and others to a high standard.

column1: Before you begin the interview process
column2: keep in mind that we have a tendency to pay special attention to those that put in extra effort in their applications. We are radical proponents of the belief that you are more than just a resume. If you’re excited about this opportunity
column3: we can’t wait to get to know you!"

The Capital One ATM Kiosk Channel is looking for a well qualified ATM industry practitioner to lead improvement efforts for the ATM monitoring and dispatching capability. The primary goal of this role is to execute and improve the ATM monitoring strategy for Capital One’s ATM fleet. Capital One currently has ~ 1900 ATMs throughout its national banking footprint. The fleet offers both cash withdraw and enhanced image deposit functionality with additional capabilities coming in the near future.
This candidate will analyze channel data and partner with Capital One IT
column3: and internal stakeholders to deliver continuous improvement efforts
column4: and to improve the quality of the ATM performance and customer experience of Capital One’s ATM fleet.

Experienced in Excel macro development and data analysis

Implementation

CFA

1+ years of experience in consulting
